org.araneaframework.uilib.core
Class OverlayRootWidget

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.core.BaseWidget
              org.araneaframework.core.BaseApplicationWidget
                  org.araneaframework.uilib.core.BaseUIWidget
                      org.araneaframework.uilib.core.OverlayRootWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, Composite, Composite.CompositeComponent, Composite.CompositeService, Composite.CompositeWidget, ApplicationComponent, ApplicationService, ApplicationWidget, Service, Viewable, Viewable.ViewableComponent, Viewable.ViewableService, Viewable.ViewableWidget, Widget
public class OverlayRootWidget
extends BaseUIWidget

This class can be used to start an overlay flow. This is provided as-is standard implementation for overlay flow that should meet the most common needs. Custom solutions may extend this class to provide additional functionality.

This class has 3 parameters:

  • childWidget - the widget that will be rendered inside the flow;
  • viewSelector - the JSP page for flow renderer (default: "overlayRoot.jsp");
  • errorPage - the JSP page to render errors (default: "/WEB-INF/jsp/error.jsp").

These parameters are configurable through constructors and setters of this class.

Here's also an example on how to use this class:
getOverlayCtx().start(new OverlayRootWidget(new MyOverlayContentWidget()));

Here's also a quick overview of "overlayRoot.jsp": 

 <ui:systemForm id="overlaySystemForm" method="post" styleClass="aranea-overlay-form">
     <ui:widgetInclude id="c"/>
 </ui:systemForm>
Note that the id and styleClass attributes must have the values as in the example above because Aranea scripts depend on them. Also the the widget to include must have exactly the same name as in the example above.

Note on the error page: the JSP can make use of variables "viewData.rootStackTrace" and "viewData.fullStackTrace" to display the error.

Since Aranea 2.0, the provided overlay content widget will be initialized upon first request to it (overlay is opened with two requests). Notice that the change was due to the problem that when opening overlay mode, messages that were put into MessageContext in an overlay component's init() method would be rendered on the parent page (because the second request had not even started yet!).

  1. A request (event) comes to a non-overlay widget that opens a widget in overlay. Overlay context is used only so much that when rendering the response page, a JavaScript script is added that opens overlay mode visually and initiates the second request.
  2. The second request goes directly to overlay mode, invokes its components and renders only overlay root and its child components. Therefore the response contains HTML fragment that is put into the visual overlay container on client-side.

Since:
1.2
Author:
Alar Kvell (alar@araneaframework.org), Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)

Field Detail

DEFAULT_ROOT_PAGE

public static String DEFAULT_ROOT_PAGE
The default page to render this overlay root widget and its sub widgets.

DEFAULT_ERROR_PAGE

public static String DEFAULT_ERROR_PAGE
The default page to render when an uncaught exception occurs.

child

protected Widget child
The sub widget to render. This widget is required.

errorPage

protected String errorPage
The page to render when an uncaught exception occurs. Note that full path must be given. The simplest constructor sets it to "/WEB-INF/jsp/error.jsp",

Constructor Detail

OverlayRootWidget

public OverlayRootWidget(Widget child)
Constructs a new root overlay widget with given subwidget to render. The sub widget is a required parameter.

This constructor also sets the view selector of the this root widget to "overlayRoot" and the error page to "/WEB-INF/jsp/error.jsp". To override these values, use the other constructor or use the setters BaseUIWidget.setViewSelector(String) and setErrorPage(String).

Parameters:
child - The sub widget (required) to render.

OverlayRootWidget

public OverlayRootWidget(Widget child,
                         String viewSelector,
                         String errorPage)
Constructs a new root overlay widget with given sub widget to render. The sub widget is a required parameter. It also allows to specify custom view selector and error page for this root overlay widget. These values are also required.

Parameters:
child - The sub widget (required) to render.
viewSelector - The page to render this widget and its sub widgets.
errorPage - The page to render when an uncaught exception occurs. Note that full path must be given.
